about_the_game:
Once upon a time, there was a magnificent kingdom that got cursed, and a prince turned into a frog. With art and animation from some of the talents behind Cuphead and the Rick & Morty show, Croak is a fractured fairy tale with a cast of quirky, lovable characters.

🎮 Pure platformer

Master the SuperBonk ability: a deceptively simple moveset that allows him to use his tongue as a grapple to propel and bounce around levels. Make good use of the interactive platforming elements, sharp reflexes, and strategic thinking in order to make it through.

🏰 Reach your Castle

The journey will take you through various biomes, each with its own gameplay twist. Traverse swamps, haunted mines, snowy mountain ranges, and try to reach the cursed castle. Unlock secret areas, discover collectibles, face enemies and defeat bosses.

🧙 Lift the curse

Why did the prince get cursed? Unravel the mystery as you explore the kingdom: its subjects transformed into animals and the realm poisoned by deadly spiky vines. This fractured fairy tale, with beautiful hand-crafted visuals, will have you leaping to the challenge in search of your hoppily ever after.

Community

Join our Discord server, track the game development, chat with the devs and apply to Croak’s insider program to access dev builds and impact production. Make your voice count and empower us to craft the best platformer ever. 🐸

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 M380
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD 4000
  • DirectX: Version 10

short_description: Croak 🐸👑 is a nimble -and challenging- precision platformer featuring an innovative grapple mechanic. Use the frog’s tongue to dash and bounce around through hundreds of hand-crafted rooms. Manipulate the environment as you traverse distinct biomes, each with unique gameplay mechanics and bosses.
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Portuguese - Portugal
